text:
So do you wanna know what a day in my life
is like? Well, I’m gonna tell you just that,

but I’m gonna do that using Phrasal verbs.
Now what exactly are Phrasal verbs? A phrasal

verb is a verb in combination with an adverb
or a preposition in such a way that the original

meaning of verb changes completely to something
different. A lot of people, who are very fluent

in English, are people, who know the art of
using phrasal verbs while speaking. So if

you want to be a fluent English speaker. You
need to learn how to use phrasal verbs and

that’s exactly what I’m gonna be looking
at today.
Hello and welcome to today’s lesson.

Like I said it’s about using phrasal verbs
to describe a day in your life. In this case

what I’m gonna do is, I’m gonna tell you
what a day in my life is like and I’m gonna

do that using phrasal verbs. Like I said a
phrasal verb is a verb plus preposition or

adverb and the specialty of a phrasal verb
is such that the original meaning of the verb

changes and becomes something else. So well
let me start with my day. Now a day in my

life looks like this, I get up in the morning
and my morning coffee helps me perk up. That’s

right; the first thing I do is drink my morning
coffee in order to perk up. Now perk up over

here means that the coffee wakes me up, now
perk is the verb and up is the preposition

together they form the phrasal verb perk up.
So as soon as I wake up in the morning, I

have my morning coffee, which helps me perk
up as in, it wakes me up or it helps me become

alert, the next thing I do is I look through
my closet and decide what I’m gonna be wearing

to work, so looking through. So when I say
look through, it means to go over or scan

quickly. Again look is your verb and along
with the preposition through, it becomes a

phrasal verb and I look through my closet
as in my cupboard quickly and figure out what

I’m wearing to work, so when you’re looking
through something, you’re not giving special

attention to every item that you are looking
at, you are just doing this very quickly,

because you know, it’s not really like an
important task that you are doing, you’re

gonna do this and finish it off quickly, so
that’s what looking through means. The next

thing that I do is I dash off to work. Now
when I say dash off, it means I rush to work

or wherever that I have to go, here again
dash is the verb and off is the preposition

together they form the phrasal verb dash off,
so the reason I’m using dash off, the reason

I’m using the phrasal verb dash off over
here, it means that I’m rushing to work,

because I’m kind of sort of always running
a little late. So I dash off or rush off to

work and then what do I do at work? I come
up with different lessons for you, that’s

right, so come here is the verb and up with
are two prepositions and the meaning is, I

prepare or work on lessons for you, that’s
right. And what’s the next thing that happens

in my work day? So as time passes and when
its lunch time, what I do is, I heat up my

food and have it. So when I say heat up, it
means, I warm my food or make it hot depending

on my preference and eat it. Over here heat
or to heat is the verb and up is the preposition

together heat up means to warm up or to make
your food hot, that’s right, that’s what

I do in my lunch hour, because I am very finicky
about my lunch, I love my food hot and I like

to have lunch on time, so that’s what I
do, I heat up my food and I eat it and as

time passes and my work day progresses, I
flesh out new ideas for work every day. So

fleshing out means to come up with or to ideate
new ideas. So when I say flesh out, it means

that I have a certain new idea and i see how
I am gonna be able to execute it or what I’m

gonna do with that idea? So what I do, when
I flesh out ideas is I make a list of new

ideas to see which are workable and if they
are workable, how I can put them into practice?

So that is the process of fleshing out as
in coming up with ideas or ideating ideas

and making them work. And before I know it,
its 6 pm and I wrap up my work, which means

I finish off my work. Over here wrap is the
verb, up is the preposition together they

make phrasal verb wrap up which means finish
or wind up. Now we all know that work never

really ends, but I am somebody, who believes
in a work life balance, so I go by the timing,

once its 6 pm. I choose to wrap up my work
or finish it or wind it up and head home.

Now what’s next? Well, my life and my day
doesn’t end just with work. There’s a

lot of things that I do after work. I visit
the store sometimes, once a week and stock

up on groceries. Now to stock here is the
verb and up the preposition together it means

to buy in a large quantity. Which means I
visit the grocery store and I buy a lot of

groceries for the week in a large quantity,
so that I don’t have to visit every single

day and that’s what it means to stock up
on groceries or supplies, which means buy

in large quantity such that you have something
for reserve. What’s the next thing I do,

which makes my evening interesting? Well we
are coming to the part that I really love

and that’s my workout. Before my workout
I warm up. Now warm here or to warm is the

verb and up the preposition together warm
up becomes a phrasal verb and It means to

do warming up exercises. So this is a great
example of how a phrasal verb has a meaning

different from the verb that is used in it.
So to warm, which means to increase the temperature

of something, but to warm up means, do warming
up exercises ,which are generally done before

any kind of workout that you might pursue,
it could be gym, it could be running, it could

be dance. All of these forms of working out
actually require that we warm up the body.

Which means we do certain preparation exercises
for the body before we start our workout . So

well that’s about warming up. What do I
do next? This is something I do in order to

chill and unwind; I meet up with my friends.
Now to meet is a verb, up the preposition

together it’s the phrasal verb. Meet up
which means to catch up or meet with friends.

So what we do generally is, we hang out at
a coffee shop, we meet up, we chat up. We

just kind of talk about our lives, day and
head home. And once I’m home, I have a light

dinner and I doesn’t take me a lot to just
dose off. Now what is dose off? To dose is

the verb off the preposition together it becomes
the phrasal verb. Dose off which means to

sleep or fall asleep quickly. So since I have
a packed day, I fall asleep very quickly,

which is what it means when I say that I just
dose off and it doesn’t take me a long time

to dose off , so well that’s all about my
day and I’ve done my best to describe my

day using phrasal verbs. You can use these
phrasal verbs and make your own story about

a day in your life. I think that would be
a great practice session for you, if you could

write about a day in your life using phrasal
verbs. I really hope you enjoyed today’s

lesson. You have anything to say to me, if
you have a question or a doubt make sure you

write to me in the comment box below. If you
want access to many many more such lessons

make sure you subscribe to our channel. It’s
me Rima saying goodbye and signing out..
